snippet: President Obama sought to take control of the surveillance debate, releasing a legal justification for domestic spying and calling for more scrutiny of National Security Agency programs.
abstract: Pres Obama seeks to take control of the surveillance debate, releasing a legal justification for domestic spying and calling for more scrutiny of National Security Agency programs; shows no inclination to curtail secret surveillance efforts brought to light by Edward J Snowden’s leaks.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: President Obama sought to take control of the surveillance debate, releasing a legal justification for domestic spying and calling for more scrutiny of National Security Agency programs.

headline.main: President Moves to Ease Worries on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: President Moves To Ease Worries On Surveillance
